posts.post_title: Limited Edition T206 Porcelain Reprint Set w/ Extras [SOLD]
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Trae R.

*******

THIS ITEM IS SOLD

*******

This is the closest I've seen to what I have for sale:
<a href="http://sports.ha.com/common/view_item.php?Sale_No=47101&Lot_No=10053" target="_new" rel="nofollow">[url]http://sports.ha.com/common/view_item.php?Sale_No=47101&Lot_No=10053</a[/url]>

[SOME PICTURES AT THE BOTTOM]

I am including that same Tinkers, Evers, and Chance limited edition set (this one is numbered odd, 2 cards are 84 and one is 88 of 1,946 made. They come in their own carrying case with certificate of authenticity. I do want to note though that the case is pretty scuffed and the card's plastic holders are chipped as well. The cards are perfect though, you will probably want to find your own display method basically. They are comprised of a Piedmont 150 and 2 Piedmont 350/460 backs.

Somewhere along the way I also picked up a Red Cobb which says "Limited Edition #17" and also has a certificate of authenticity. It has a Piedmont 350 back.

Then finally, the mother load I am including is a nice 22 card HOF set with it's own custom wooden box, and each card is in a snap down, in perfect condition. Each of these is numbered #7 of 1,909 sets. It also includes a certificate of authenticity. The cards are a mix of Piedmont 350, Piedmont 350/460, and EPDG (in blue though).

The following cards are in this set:

Baker
Beckley
Bresnahan Batting
Bresnahan Portrait
Duffy
Johnson Portrait
Johnson Pitching
Keeler
Keeler Portrait
Kelley
Lajoie Batting
Lajoie Throwing
Lajoie Portrait
McGraw Finger
McGraw Portrait
McGraw Glove at Hip
McGraw Portrait w/Cap
Plank
Speaker
Waddell Throwing
Waddell Portrait
Wagner (Honus)

2 Years ago I paid $170 shipped (will include original receipt) for the wooden boxed set alone, I will sell the whole kit-n-kaboodle above for $90 shipped.

Emails have priority
trae@t206.org

PayPal Preferred
